content:
Certainly! Here are the deliverables broken down into smaller components:

* Data ingestion
	+ Ingest data from Coinbase API
	+ Ingest data from Reddit API
	+ Ingest data from Twitter API
	+ Ensure data is cleaned and normalized
* Data processing
	+ Analyze data using statistical methods
	+ Analyze data using machine learning methods
	+ Transform data for use in machine learning models
* Statistical analysis
	+ Develop statistical models for predicting crypto currency market movements
	+ Test and evaluate the accuracy of the statistical models
* Machine learning
	+ Develop machine learning models for predicting crypto currency market movements
	+ Test and evaluate the accuracy of the machine learning models
* Prediction generation
	+ Combine the results of the statistical and machine learning models to generate predictions
* Result scaling
	+ Scale the contribution of each prediction method based on its historical accuracy
* Web interface
	+ Design the user interface
	+ Implement the front-end
	+ Implement the back-end
* Modularity and scalability
	+ Ensure the system is designed in a modular way to allow individual components to be swapped out or extended easily
	+ Use APIs and protocols like protobuf to facilitate communication between components
* Performance
	+ Ensure the system is highly performant to provide up-to-date information as quickly as possible
	+ Use parallel computing to improve performance
* Hosting
	+ Host the system in the same AWS datacenter as Coinbase to minimize latency

Does this provide the level of detail you were looking for?
